title: Finlandia Invicta (British stamp, 1940)
Text:: Finlandia Invicta [Invincible Finland].Year  ca. 1940Publisher  NA.Artist  NA.Additional information  Issued in support of Finland during the Winter War, depicting a soldier in winter gear standing over a mother and child. While no creator is indicated on the stamp, it is possible that it was produced by the London-based “Finland Fund,” which issued various printed ephemera during the war to support the Finnish war effort. Pictured below on a letter sent in April 1940 (by which point the war was over).
